class pymeta.Default[source]¶

Bases: object

overwrite(**options)[source]¶

overwrite already-existing/default values in self.dict ‘ ‘with the ones in the options dictionary. if the options dictionary has keys that are not in orig, they are not assigned to orig. This function is intended for easy, safe option assignments in places like __init__() functions

class pymeta.FixBounds[source]¶

Namespace for static methods of fixing bounds

static exceeder_random(ob, pos)[source]¶

assign random values only to the dimensions that are out of bounds

static full_random(ob, pos)[source]¶
static to_edges(ob, pos)[source]¶

out of bounds dimensions are moved to edges.

pymeta.mkdirfor(path)[source]¶
pymeta.nparray(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Unless dtype is specified, makesure new array has float type

pymeta.overwrite(orig, **options)[source]¶

overwrite already-existing/default values in the original dictionary with the ones in the options dictionary. if the options dictionary has keys that are not in orig, they are not assigned to orig. This function is intended for easy, safe option assignments in places like __init__() functions

pymeta.randdiv(amount, cnt)[source]¶

Divides the AMOUNT into CNT random parts and returns those parts in a numpy array. CNT must not be bigger than AMOUNT. Both CNT and AMOUNT must be integers.

>>> random.seed(0)
>>> randdiv(100,10)
array([ 5,  6,  9,  8, 11, 15,  8,  9, 17, 12])
pymeta.randin(lb, ub)[source]¶

return random array with elements between the elements of lb and ub. ub is not included.

pymeta.randintbetween(mat1, mat2)[source]¶

return a matrix with random elements between elements of corresponding mat1 and mat2 elements.

pymeta.rotationmatrix(D, c)[source]¶

Translated from the Matlab function rot_matrix of P. N. Suganthan

pymeta.rotationmatrixsuganthan(D, c, rotmatspath)[source]¶
